org.hibernate.shards
Interface Shard

All Known Implementing Classes:
ShardImpl
public interface Shard

Interface representing a Shard. A shard is a physical partition (as opposed to a virtual partition). Shards know how to lazily instantiate Sessions and apply OpenSessionEvents, CriteriaEvents, and QueryEvents. Anybody else have a nagging suspicion this can get folded into the Session itself?

Author:
maxr@google.com (Max Ross) Tomislav Nad

Method Detail

getSessionFactoryImplementor

org.hibernate.engine.SessionFactoryImplementor getSessionFactoryImplementor()
Returns:
the SessionFactoryImplementor that owns the Session associated with this Shard

getSession

org.hibernate.classic.Session getSession()
Returns:
the Session associated with this Shard. Will return null if the Session has not yet been established.

addOpenSessionEvent

void addOpenSessionEvent(OpenSessionEvent event)
Parameters:
event - the event to add

establishSession

org.hibernate.classic.Session establishSession()
Returns:
establish a Session using the SessionFactoryImplementor associated with this Shard and apply any OpenSessionEvents that have been added. If the Session has already been established just return it.

getCriteriaById

org.hibernate.Criteria getCriteriaById(CriteriaId id)
Parameters:
id - the id of the Criteria
Returns:
the Critieria uniquely identified by the given id (unique to the Shard)

addCriteriaEvent

void addCriteriaEvent(CriteriaId id,
                      CriteriaEvent event)
Parameters:
id - the id of the Criteria with which the event should be associated
event - the event to add

establishCriteria

org.hibernate.Criteria establishCriteria(ShardedCriteria shardedCriteria)
Parameters:
shardedCriteria - the ShardedCriteria for which this Shard should create an actual Criteria object.
Returns:
a Criteria for the given ShardedCriteria

See Also:

getShardIds

Set<ShardId> getShardIds()
Returns:
the ids of the virtual shards that are mapped to this physical shard. The returned Set is unmodifiable.

getQueryById

org.hibernate.Query getQueryById(QueryId queryId)
Parameters:
queryId - the id of the Query
Returns:
the Query uniquely identified by the given id (unique to the Shard)
